bill_title: repeal the prohibition against carrying a concealed weapon in the state capitol.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to repeal the prohibition against carrying a concealed weapon in the state capitol. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 22-14-22 be amended to read: 22-14-22. For the purposes of §§ 22-14-23 to 22-14-28, inclusive, the term, county courthouse, means the state capitol or any building occupied for the public sessions of a circuit court, with its various offices. The term includes any building appended to or used as a supplementary structure to a county courthouse. Section 2. That chapter 22-14 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any person who knowingly possesses or causes to be present any firearm or other dangerous weapon in the state capitol building, or attempts to do so, is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor. However, this section does not apply to any person who is carrying a concealed pistol and possesses a permit to carry a concealed pistol issued pursuant to chapter 23-7 or any law enforcement official permitted to carry a weapon. Section 3. That chapter 22-14 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The Governor, any Supreme Court justice, any constitutional officer, the speaker of the House, and the president pro tempore of the Senate may post signs in each respective office or gallery prohibiting the carry of any concealed weapon within the office or gallery. Section 4. That chapter 22-14 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any legislator that chooses to carry a concealed weapon in the Capitol as permitted by this Act may inform the Capitol security of the possession of the weapon and may volunteer the legislator's assistance if necessary.
